meanings.sent1: She accidentally retears her paper while trying to fix it.
meanings.sent2: He carefully retears the wrapping paper to reuse it.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy retears the same toy every time she gets it.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds retear the fragile fabric of the tent.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages are so delicate that they retear easily.

meanings.definition: The act of tearing or ripping again.
meanings.sent1: The retears in the painting were carefully repaired by the artist.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the retears in his jeans after the rough play.
meanings.sent3: The retears in the fabric made the dress look intentionally distressed.
meanings.sent4: The retears in the document made it difficult to read the important information.
meanings.sent5: The retears in the map showed the route the hiker had taken.
